tweets.text: @EnvAgency Obviously much more important than say stopping @thameswater dumping sewage into the Hogsmill River, one of only two urban chalk streams in the whole of Greater London. https://t.co/tINdhTOg2I

The reality of @DefraGovUK's commitment the environment, to our rivers, our chalk streams, exposed for the empty posturing that it is.

So much for the 25 year plans, the rhetoric, the hollow words, the false promises.

Care to comment @MPGeorgeEustice @pow_rebecca @ZacGoldsmith? https://t.co/RfTKuc5fhk

tweets.text:
NEW: Soil pollution is damaging Herefordshire's rivers and hitting fish species. 
Officers from @EnvAgencyMids are inspecting hundreds of recently harvested fields at risk from heavy rain, reminding farmers what steps they can take. Enforcement action could follow.@DaveThroupEA https://t.co/N5H3UQiaBQ
https://t.co/YYHxq6riL0 https://t.co/szptwQtwNX
WATCH Becca and Alice invertebrate sampling on the #Wandle #LRW2020 #LondonRiversWeek https://t.co/I53WP67pbN

Dog poo contains bacteria which can be harmful to people & wildlife. 

üíôMake sure when you are out with your dog this half term you clean up after them!

üåäKeep our water healthy for everyone, even if you're not  near a beach! 

#BagItBinIt #BinIt4Beaches #RespectProtectEnjoy https://t.co/I2vGET8kPH

tweets.text:
This October half term do your bit to keep our environment clean.

Bag up your dog poo and put it in the bin.

#BagItBinIt #BinIt4Beaches https://t.co/j0Tnipo1ro

Our staff have been working with @EnvAgencyMids and @BhamCityCouncil to renaturalise parts of the River Cole, adding curve, creating habitats & improving conditions for fish and invertebrate population movements. It‚Äôs part of our vision to improve the river for wildlife & people https://t.co/4xPmOEt3Aa
fabulous art interpreting Steart Marshes @WWTSteart @WWTworldwide @WWTconservation  @EnvAgencySW @NESouthWest @BridgwaterArts #healthandwellbeing  https://t.co/qB0H89kXBA

tweets.text:
@seasonalight @jamespearson88 @NickyGeeson @EnvAgencyMids We‚Äôre not trying to catch farmers out and advice is almost always first course of action.

However, some have received guidance but practice hasn‚Äôt changed.

Still time to catch this on demand‚Ä¶

We pursued three waste criminals across London and surrounding counties to put two men in prison‚Ä¶   

Watch the whole story on #DefendersUK on #BBC1, and how we got the right result: https://t.co/fWkgl1MKRP https://t.co/3J9KCtAcmV

Join in TOMORROW at 11am for #LondonRiversWeek2020, to listen to TEP's Amy Pryor and Richard Charman from @EnvAgency discuss Estuary Edges and the benefits of softening brick, concrete and metal tidal walls on the #Thames.

Click here to join: https://t.co/6d2eSNjcFx https://t.co/CjDt7r8SOp

tweets.text: @SeanSpe85096058 @WBMCarpFishing @EnvAgency He is only saying what lots of anglers have been saying for years .  Trouble was with the weekly's some of the reporting was weeks old , and some of the story's were from la la land .

@Hyosube @eabroken2020 @EnvAgency @EmmaHowardBoyd @thetimes Badly organised. They have 11,000 employees. How many are field based delivering enforcement or environmental protection? A small percentage I'll wager.

Thanks everyone for making #JNCC_EO4water such a success! @BrockmannCon @PlymouthMarine @EMODnet @CefasGovUK @EnvAgency @StirUni @ScottishEPA @UniRdg_Met @geoaquawatch @DefraGovUK & of course @CopernicusEU If you missed it, the videos, slides & other resources are now available! https://t.co/B2hZ2aTsno

We are working in multiple catchments delivering #naturebasedsolutions through #naturalfloodmanagement. We work with landowners to create storage pools, wetlands & leaky dams which all help to #slowtheflow of water as well as clean it & provide wonderful habitat @EnvAgency https://t.co/7PkzJBXb2A

World fish migration day!üêü

The @EnvAgency has installed a number of eel passes which are used to help eels migrate and get past obstructions.

They also give us a chance to count and closely monitor this endangered species. #Eels #worldfishmigrationday @fishmigration https://t.co/IN7aZ8cCtX

#NaturalFloodManagement is a key tool in mitigating the effects of extreme weather. We are working with partners across catchments in the county to #slowtheflow & store water whilst also creating wildlife habitat @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @StaffordshireCC @SoTCityCouncil https://t.co/7mvhiUCQjp

This time last year #StormCiara & #StormDennis brought devastating floods to Staffordshire. Today we mark that event with tweets about what we are working on to help mitigate flooding #naturalfloodmanagement #naturebasedsolutions @EnvAgency @theriverstrust @TrentCaba @WildStoke https://t.co/F8Y2Lk1Rgw
(2/2) that the proposed waste #incinerator at #Rivenhall Airfield would generate as much CO2 as all the other industrial facilities in Essex put together - about 600,000 tonnes CO2 per annum.

The historic concrete culvert in a tributary of the Torridge represented a barrier to fish movement. The old quarry track was no longer used and the landowner agreed to the culverts removal, opening up >2km of watercourse upstream to fish @EnvAgency #WEG #TRRP https://t.co/8096LIr5kJ

Brilliant @Unchecked_UK report shows effects of severe funding cuts at @NaturalEngland & @EnvAgency on enforcement. They need major capital & revenue investment at #SpendingReview to fulfil current functions, let alone deliver the #EnvironmentBill & #ELM.

https://t.co/CCvpt8Gk7O

We are excited to announce that our online 2020 Conference, 24-26 Nov, @NatInvest will feature three of six webinars in the Investment Readiness Fund series hosted by @GFI_green on behalf of @EnvAgency and @DefraGovUK. Book your free place now  
https://t.co/ZTGYZyvfl4 https://t.co/03VgoMFD5D

tweets.text: I‚Äôm a conservative. If I were American I‚Äôd find it hard to vote Republican. Ecocide is the antithesis of conservatism.  https://t.co/udnrK0sS1T

In 2010 Govt set a target to get 50% of all SSSIs in England into "favourable condition" by 2020. 

In 2018 the Govt set a new target: 75% SSSIs in favourable condition by 2042. 

The % of SSSIs in favourable condition dropped from 44% in 2003 to 38.9% in March 2020. Progress! https://t.co/Fu2zrIjG0w
@Tidyboilerone Some "friend" of somebody who knows somebody in the  government needs to make money out of people's and animals misery and pain.
@RussellB1ggs @SEGandrewK @theriverstrust @N_Rivers_Trust @PondRiverStream @EnvAgencyAnglia That would be an easy fix....

tweets.text: Look who was found in the #Thames recently! Historically a common sight, the migratory Twaite shad is now rare and it was great to see it near Blackfriars in Central London! #WorldFishMigrationDay #LRW2020 #LondonRiversWeek #TidewayLondon https://t.co/MjBH1APVkg

@jamespearson88 @NickyGeeson @EnvAgencyMids @DaveThroupEA education, please, and then enforcement. It really worries me that without best info networks, farmers just feel got-at, and then go the other way. I write about river ecology and I grew up here.

Do regulators need to justify their existence? 

#nationalcommission #regulationsummit
We took @bbchw on one of our soil patrols and this is what they found... https://t.co/X2y3dLi3bH
